result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew James Geyser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

If probation is revoked and jail sentence is served, defendant may serve the jail sentencing in a jail convenient to employment or residence.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 

Defendant shall undergo random screens of his blood, breath, or urine. 

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew James Geyser

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew James Geyser in court.  Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Matthew James Geyser.  Information rec'd and reading waived.  Based on plea negotiations and on a plea to Ct 1, Ct's 2, 3, and 4 are to be dismissed and read in. Guilty plea entered on Ct 1; Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1, Ct 2, 3, and 4 are dismissed for read in.  Argument from State, Defense; Statements from defendant. Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in court and by Attorney Matthew Weil.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew James Geyser in court and by Attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Counsel's first appearance.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 2:45 p.m.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew James Geyser in court, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Matthew James Geyser. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Court orders $1,500.00 signature bond.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender. Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
